s.label: Image settings
s.desc: These settings are used when running the OSKAR imager.

s.label: Use double precision
s.desc: Determines whether double precision arithmetic is used.

s.label: Use GPUs
s.desc: Use GPU devices if available.

s.label: CUDA device IDs to use
s.desc: A comma-separated string containing device (GPU) IDs to use on a multi-GPU system, or 'all' to use all devices.

s.label: Number of compute devices
s.desc: Number of compute devices to use. A compute device is either a local CPU core, or a GPU. Don't set this to more than the number of CPU cores in your system.

s.label: Specify cellsize
s.desc: If set, specify cellsize; otherwise, specify field of view.

s.label: Field of view [deg]
s.desc: Total field of view in degrees.

s.label: Cellsize [arcsec]
s.desc: The cell (pixel) size in arcseconds.

s.label: Image dimension [pixels]
s.desc: Image width in one dimension (e.g. a value of 256 would give a 256 by 256 image). This must be even.

s.label: Image type
s.desc:
The type of image to generate. Note that the Stokes parameter images (if selected) are uncalibrated, and are formed simply using the standard combinations of the linear polarisations:
I = 0.5 (XX + YY)
Q = 0.5 (XX - YY)
U = 0.5 (XY + YX)
V = -0.5i (XY - YX)
The point spread function of the observation can be generated using the PSF option.

s.label: Channel snapshots
s.desc: If true, then produce an image cube containing snapshots for each frequency channel. If false, then use frequency-synthesis to stack the channels in the final image.

s.label: Minimum frequency [Hz]
s.desc: The minimum visibility channel centre frequency to include in the image or image cube, in Hz.

s.label: Maximum frequency [Hz]
s.desc: The maximum visibility channel centre frequency to include in the image or image cube, in Hz.

s.label: Minimum time (UTC)
s.desc:
The minimum visibility time centroid to include in the image. This can be either a MJD value or a string with one of the following formats:
d-M-yyyy h:m:s.z
yyyy/M/d/h:m:s.z
yyyy-M-d h:m:s.z
yyyy-M-dTh:m:s.z
where:
d is the day number (1 to 31)
M is the month (1 to 12)
yyyy is the year (4 digits)
h is the hour (0 to 23)
m is minutes (0 to 59)
s is seconds (0 to 59)
z is milliseconds (0 to 999)

s.label: Maximum time (UTC)
s.desc:
The maximum visibility time centroid to include in the image. This can be either a MJD value or a string with one of the following formats:
d-M-yyyy h:m:s.z
yyyy/M/d/h:m:s.z
yyyy-M-d h:m:s.z
yyyy-M-dTh:m:s.z
where:
d is the day number (1 to 31)
M is the month (1 to 12)
yyyy is the year (4 digits)
h is the hour (0 to 23)
m is minutes (0 to 59)
s is seconds (0 to 59)
z is milliseconds (0 to 999)

s.label: UV filter min [wavelengths]
s.desc: The minimum UV baseline length to image, in wavelengths.

s.label: UV filter max [wavelengths]
s.desc: The maximum UV baseline length to image, in wavelengths.

s.label: Algorithm
s.desc: The type of transform used to generate the image.

s.label: Weighting
s.desc: The type of visibility weighting scheme to use.

s.label: Use GPU for FFT
s.desc: If true, use the GPU to perform the FFT.

s.label: Convolution kernel type
s.desc: The type of gridding kernel to use.

s.label: Support size
s.desc: The support size used for the gridding kernel.

s.label: Oversample factor
s.desc: The oversample factor used for the gridding kernel.

s.label: Use GPU to generate W-kernels
s.desc: If true, use the GPU to generate the W-kernels.

s.label: Number of W-planes
s.desc: The number of W-planes to use. Values less than 1 mean "auto".

s.label: Image centre direction
s.desc:
Specifies the direction of the image phase centre.
If Observation direction is selected, the image is centred on the pointing direction of the primary beam.
If RA, Dec. is selected, the image is centred on the values of RA and Dec. found below.

s.label: Image centre RA (degrees)
s.desc: The Right Ascension of the image phase centre. This value is used if the image centre direction is set to 'RA, Dec.'.

s.label: Image centre Dec. (degrees)
s.desc: The Declination of the image phase centre. This value is used if the image centre direction is set to 'RA, Dec.'.

s.label: Input visibility data file(s)
s.desc: Path to the input OSKAR visibility data file(s) or Measurement Set(s).

s.label: Scale normalisation with number of input files
s.desc:
Sets the option to scale image normalisation with number of input files.
Set this to true if the different files represent multiple sky model components observed with the same telescope configuration and observation parameters.
Set this to false if the different files represent multiple observations of the same sky observed with different telescope configurations or observation parameters.

s.label: Measurement Set column
s.desc: The name of the column in the Measurement Set to use, if applicable.

s.label: Output image root path
s.desc:
The root filename used to save the output image. The full filename will be constructed as <root>_<image_type>.fits
If left blank when running the application, the output file name will be based on the name of the first input file.
